page.title: 01REDRUTH..A GAZETTEER
page.content: This block includes the Northern part of Redruth, the surrounding countryside and the villages of North Country and Mt. Ambrose. The A30 trunk road crosses the block. The town (pop. 43000) has a mainly pre-war centre,dating back to the hey-day of copper mining in the 1850's, a large post war council estate and some modern housing estates. The surrounding countryside is mainly permanent pasture supporting small herds of beef and dairy cattle. There are many disused mine shafts and engine houses. South Crofty Mine in the West of the block is the nearest working mine and a major local employer.The Cardrew Industrial Estate also provides employment for many Redruth men- most of the businesses being light industry or tourist related.
